presentation.title: Making APIs the Default: Enabling Everybody to Think the API Way
presentation.toc: APIs are much more than technology. It becomes increasingly apparent that by only focusing on their technology aspects, you're missing out on the biggest opportunities that APIs create for your organization and your business. In our work with large organizations we have realized that one essential aspect of realizing the value proposition of APIs is to API-enable all of the organization. This is particularly important for product managers, who need to start thinking about every single product of an organization as a digital building block. We present our way of how we make sure that "Thinking the API Way" becomes the default for everybody in the line of business. Because in the end, the value of APIs critically depends on how much of an organization's business and value chains are exposed using APIs. Only then it becomes possible to benefit from the loose coupling and the increased velocity that APIs can deliver.

ul.li: Learn how a modern platform strategy needs an API strategy to make sure that the platform is evolving.
Start looking at APIs as an indispensable aspect of every product and how to integrate this aspect into product management.
Understand that API value is driven by product value and that therefore all APIs must be aligned with the value proposition of the product and your platform.

presentation.title: API Management for Grown-Ups: From Gateways to Portals to Catalogs
presentation.toc: APIs are becoming increasingly important at the business level, because they are an essential ingredient of Digital Transformation. The growing importance of APIs highlights the increasing digitalization of businesses and our society and economy in general. But it also creates new challenges how to best surface and manage these inherently technical artifacts for a variety of users. APIs have matured from connectivity that only matters on a very technical level to capabilities that can drive enormous amounts of value (just think of Stripe or Twilio). The API community moved from gateways as a way to address general technical concerns, to portals for improving developers experience (DX) and making APIs easier to find and use, to platforms which address the increasing decentralization and heterogeneity of today's IT landscape. This presentation discusses this development, the driving factors, and what you can learn from it for the future of APIs.

presentation.title: Creating an API Strategy that helps the Business
presentation.toc: APIs are more than just technology; they are the digital nervous system of modern organizations. What an organization can do in the digital space is both enabled and constrained by the way that it manages its APIs. It is therefore important to have an API strategy that goes beyond the technical aspects of design and implementation, and that makes sure that the organization makes the most out of how it uses APIs. On the organizational side, teams must be enabled and encouraged to use APIs as they way in which they collaborate. On the business side, it is important to start thinking of value chains as being composed out of digital building blocks, and to clearly focus on conceiving and designing all value-generating activities as building blocks. An API strategy embracing all of these aspects makes sure that organizations get the most out of their digital investments.
